title: Simply Roasted Artichokes Recipe
description: Learn how to cook artichokes in the oven with this simple and delicious recipe from Chef John that emphasizes the natural flavor of the artichoke.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Vegetarian Simply Roasted Artichokes 4.3 (117) 85 Reviews 17 Photos Learn how to cook artichokes in the oven with this easy recipe. It's so simple — it's hard to call it a recipe! By John Mitzewich John Mitzewich John Mitzewich — aka Chef John — has produced more than 1,500 cooking videos for Allrecipes. He's the actor, director, and screenwriter whose hands and voice confidently walk you through techniques. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on November 16, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 17 17 17 17 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 20 mins Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 large whole artichokes, top 1 inch and stems removed ¼ cup fresh lemon juice ¼ cup olive oil 4 cloves garlic, cloves peeled and crushed kosher salt Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place artichokes stem-side down in a bowl and drizzle with lemon juice. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Slightly separate the artichoke leaves with your hands. Insert a knife blade into the center of each artichoke to create a garlic clove-size space. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Drizzle each artichoke with olive oil and press 1 clove of garlic into the center of each artichoke; season with salt. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Tightly wrap each artichoke twice with heavy-duty aluminum foil; place in a baking dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until sizzling, about 1 hour 20 minutes Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 307 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 204 Calories 14g Fat 19g Carbs 6g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 204 % Daily Value * Total Fat 14g 18% Saturated Fat 2g 10% Sodium 253mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 19g 7% Dietary Fiber 9g 32% Total Sugars 2g Protein 6g 11% Vitamin C 27mg 30% Calcium 78mg 6% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 631mg 13% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Simply Roasted Artichokes 01 of 17 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 17 Photo by  Lucardy 09/29/2020 So simple to make and delicious 03 of 17 Photo by  Bs0cial 09/03/2020 04 of 17 Photo by  Chef Mo 02/29/2020 First time cooking artichoke and this recipe was perfect! Followed exactly as written and will be my go to for artichokes from now on! 05 of 17 Photo by  Trisha 09/10/2018 I will give this five stars, but I deviated from the original recipe. The only thing I did not change was the olive oil. I did not use lemon, it is unnecessary. I “core” my artichokes before roasting. This way there is less work and more time for eating while hot. First, cut off the end of each leaf with kitchen shears and the full top of the artichoke with a knife. Open wide and scoop out the center of the heart to get all the prickly center removed. This is done easily under running water. Cut the end of the stem off, but leave most of it because there is a lot of edible meat in the stem. Dry off then drizzle with olive oil. Add sea salt, fresh ground pepper and garlic powder making sure to get in between all the leaves and center. Wrap in foil. I think the time and temp is too high and long. I roast at 375 degrees for 1 hour. You can test the tenderness in the stem. If the stem is cooked through, it is done. I use a melted butter sauce for dipping. I usually add a little hot sauce to the butter, a nice jalapeño hot sauce really makes it delicious! So overall good base recipe. Enjoy a Hagandaaz ice cream bar for dessert! 06 of 17 Photo by  Lynette Shooter 06/12/2018 07 of 17 Photo by  Eddie 05/19/2018 Super simple and delicious! 08 of 17 Photo by  Irene Y 05/07/2018 Simple and fool-proof recipe with okay results. I love garlic so I used at least three cloves per artichoke, and distributed around the entire thing (not just in the centre). Even more garlic would have been good, for my taste. 09 of 17 Photo by  Bren 02/13/2018 They were just okay for us. I love artichokes and lemon, just not together. 10 of 17 Photo by  Amanda Lopez 03/16/2017 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Asparagus Pie 158 Ratings Simple Smoked Asparagus Artichoke and Sun-Dried Tomato Chicken 454 Ratings Grilled Artichokes 331 Ratings Simple Steamed Artichokes Recipe 15 Ratings Baked Spinach and Artichoke Toasts 8 Ratings Creamy Tomato Artichoke Soup 11 Ratings Eggplant Parmesan Casserole 187 Ratings Baked Tofu and Green Beans with Spicy Rhubarb Sauce 1 Rating Portobello Mushroom Caps and Veggies 58 Ratings Baked Asparagus 1 Rating Pesto Zoodles 65 Ratings Pesto Farro with Spring Veggies Grilled Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms 381 Ratings Buddha Bowl Power Menu Sunday Morning Asian Frittata 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: John Mitzewich

Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Drizzle each artichoke with olive oil and press 1 clove of garlic into the center of each artichoke; season with salt.
